Text.Value: Apologies. Even the littlest thing wears me out.
Much time was lost, but no more. Now we can be there for our daughter.
I think I need to clear my head now, dear... we'll speak later.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused and tired. Not quite in full possession of her faculties

Text.Value: It comes and goes... and eventually, it will come more often than it goes.
We shall remain here at camp and continue to recover whatever strength we can. Then, perhaps, when all is said and done... we can be a family again.
How do you feel now? You seemed... confused before.
I heard birdsong, at dusk, coming here. You don't know what it's like to hear that music again after so long without... thank you.
Better, in a sense... but you may need to prepare yourself, daughter. Shar took a great deal from me... and time will eventually take the rest. Sooner than you or your father would like, perhaps.
You surpassed those daydreams in every way.
Just one - take care of yourself. I know you have more struggles yet to come out there, but I do not want to lose my daughter so soon after I found her again.
Time is far crueller than Shar could ever be. I... do not think I will ever get better. But I wish to make the most of the time I have left. With my family.
You should rest. There'll be time to talk later.
Not yet. I think she's still trying to find the words. She still feels responsible  I fear... I don't want her to punish herself.
Old. I was a young woman when they seized me... Arnell and I had hoped Jen would be joined by siblings... but that dream's gone now, and there's a stranger in the mirror.
Shadowheart. May Sel√ªne guide you always, my daughter.
Shadowheart. I hope all is well, my dear.
How do you feel?
Leave.
Leave me. We have nothing more to discuss, Sharran.
I... I knew this, even when I first fell for your father. He is destined to outlive me, as are you.
My hands... they're not my hands. And my reflection... I'm not used to that woman yet.
You're too generous. I should have freed you sooner.
Are you feeling any better now?
Have you spoken to Shadowheart since?
Is there anything I can do for you?
Besides, I'm tougher than I look - I'll fight on, now that I have something to fight for.
How do you feel?
Oh. I see. More than a friend. Apologies, I forget my little girl is not so little any more.
Shed no tears - we've been blessed with a second chance - and who is to say how long we'll have? More than I ever hoped for, certainly.
Leave.
Slow. Tired. It's strange... I feel like I've mislaid myself in some old woman's body.
Moonmaiden's blessings to you.
Some. I think she's still trying to find the words. She still feels responsible I fear... I don't want her to punish herself.
We must not live in fear of loss. That is not truly living.
What comes now?
You couldn't have. You knew nothing - just like they wanted. But it doesn't matter now. It's all behind us.
We are a small family - smaller than I hoped for - but we are whole again.
Though the ache in my bones would suggest otherwise. A little rest shall do me wonders. Yes... then I'll feel more like myself once again.
Arnell is your husband. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].
Jenevelle is your daughter. I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].
I think you may be confused - I'm not Shadowheart, I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].
I should rest a little. We'll talk soon, Arnell.
I should rest a little. We'll talk soon, Jenevelle.
I should rest a little. We'll talk soon, Shadowheart.
My daughter found her way in the end. And found a good friend in you along the way.
What comes for you now?
You shouldn't be here. You should still be rotting in the dark, at the Nightsinger's pleasure.
You shouldn't be here. You should still be rotting away in the dark.
You shouldn't even be here. You're a liability and a distraction for Shadowheart.
Such cruel, pointless words Shar forces upon your lips. Leave me - I won't have my joy spoiled by her pawn.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tone hardening. She's not about to take shit from us just now.

Text.Value: How do you feel?
You won't need to daydream any more. I'm here, for real.
Leave.
I'm glad things worked out for you and your family.
Don't worry - I shall pull my weight and help how I can. After so long in captivity, it feels good to use my hands again.
Now this old lady will be getting in the way in your fine camp, I'm afraid.
I think I need to clear my head now, dear... we'll speak later.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused and tired. Not quite in full possession of her faculties

Text.Value: How do you feel?
Oh, I see. Do forgive me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dazed. Not quite grasping her mistake.

EditorData.stateContext: Emmeline has recoverd somewhat - straighter posture, clear-eyed

Text.Value: But I shall persevere. A little rest shall do me wonders. Yes... then I'll feel more like myself again.
I think things will be better, now that we've talked to Shadowheart.
Rest, yes... we'll talk more later. Once I feel more like myself.
Only you can say. It seems your father and I have returned to a world in turmoil, and I sense you have a part to play in righting things.
My girl. Let me look at you. For so long I had to imagine what you were like - what you had grown up to be.
But I still have my teeth. That first apple was worth the wait.
I know you are. We have so much to catch up on... in a little while. After I've had some rest. Once I feel more like myself.
You're welcome.

Synopsis:
Default camp dialog for Shadowheart's mom. She has recovered somewhat from her ordeal in the Shar grotto, but will never truly heal - she's grown old in captivity, and she's prone to confusion at times. Still, she remains glad and supportive.
She has unique branches for Shadowheart and non-Shadowheart players, as well as branches that occur before and after CAMP_Shadowheart_DaughterTears, in which SH and her parents have their first proper heart to heart.
